trans-unit.source: Register table operations in Azure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Register table operations in Azure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: The topics in this section provide information and specific examples for creating and working with JavaScript backend server scripts that are registered to table operations in <token>firstref_zumo</token>.
trans-unit.target: The topics in this section provide information and specific examples for creating and working with JavaScript backend server scripts that are registered to table operations in <token>firstref_zumo</token>.

trans-unit.source: For topics related to server scripts in general, see <link xlink:href="9ce364a3-876b-482d-87c0-56157e7d4bed" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Business logic in Azure Mobile Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: For topics related to server scripts in general, see <link xlink:href="9ce364a3-876b-482d-87c0-56157e7d4bed" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Business logic in Azure Mobile Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: This same content is available as help in the <token>firstref_azportal</token>.
trans-unit.target: This same content is available as help in the <token>firstref_azportal</token>.

trans-unit.source: For more general information about <token>nextref_zumo</token> and examples of how to use <token>nextref_zumo</token> in your apps, see <externalLink><linkText>Mobile Services Tutorials and Resources</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=266220</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more general information about <token>nextref_zumo</token> and examples of how to use <token>nextref_zumo</token> in your apps, see <externalLink><linkText>Mobile Services Tutorials and Resources</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=266220</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Describes how to define and use server scripts that are registered against table operations in <token>nextref_zumo</token>.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to define and use server scripts that are registered against table operations in <token>nextref_zumo</token>.

trans-unit.source: Shows an example of how to modify a request to a table operation.
trans-unit.target: Shows an example of how to modify a request to a table operation.

trans-unit.source: Shows an example of how to modify the default response to a table operation request.
trans-unit.target: Shows an example of how to modify the default response to a table operation request.

trans-unit.source: Shows an example of how to validate request data for a table operation.
trans-unit.target: Shows an example of how to validate request data for a table operation.

trans-unit.source: Show an example of how to access data tables from server scripts.
trans-unit.target: Show an example of how to access data tables from server scripts.

trans-unit.source: Show an example of how to modify an operation based on an authenticated user.
trans-unit.target: Show an example of how to modify an operation based on an authenticated user.

trans-unit.source: Show an example of how to send a push notification from a server script.
trans-unit.target: Show an example of how to send a push notification from a server script.

trans-unit.source: Shows an example of how to send an HTTP request from a script.
trans-unit.target: Shows an example of how to send an HTTP request from a script.

trans-unit.source: Shows an example of how to override default error handling for requests.
trans-unit.target: Shows an example of how to override default error handling for requests.

trans-unit.source: Shows an example of how, from scripts, to only allow administers to perform operations.
trans-unit.target: Shows an example of how, from scripts, to only allow administers to perform operations.

trans-unit.source: Describes how to debug server scripts.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to debug server scripts.

trans-unit.source: Details the shortcut keys available in the script editor in the <token>nextref_azportal</token>.
trans-unit.target: Details the shortcut keys available in the script editor in the <token>nextref_azportal</token>.
